p: Using the Gompertz model, the estimated growth in COVID-19 cases would have reached a total of 7,466 by May 15, compared with the 1,311 observed ( Fig 4). Similarly, the Gompertz model estimates 354 COVID-19 deaths by June 1, compared with 143 observed ( Fig 5), for a total 6,155 COVID-19 cases and 211 deaths averted during the observation period. Given the relatively small number of observations, the predictive intervals are too wide to be meaningful.
